prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with zero euler angles and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.025). This will position the prism slightly above the origin. Creating the Sketch For the first face, create a loop with four lines: 1. Line 1: Start at (0, 0) and end at (0.75, 0). 2. Line 2: Start at (0.75, 0) and end at (0.75, 0.25). 3. Line 3: Start at (0.75, 0.25) and end at (0, 0.25). 4. Line 4: Start at (0, 0.25) and end at (0, 0). This sketch defines a rectangle with a width of 0.75 and a height of 0.25. Creating the 3D Model from the Sketch Now scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch scaling parameter. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depths are equal (towards and opposite the normal), both being 0.0125 units. This will create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with zero euler angles and a translation vector of (0.3625, 0.205, 0.05). This will position the cylindrical object away from the origin and at the height of the prism's tapered middle section. Creating the Sketch For the first face, create a loop with a single circle: 1. Circle: Center at (0.0125, 0.0125) with a radius of 0.0125. This sketch defines a circle, which will become the top surface of the cylindrical object. Creating the 3D Model from the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.025 using the sketch scaling parameter. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0641 (opposite the normal direction) to create a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom that fits into the tapered middle section of the rectangular prism. These instructions describe how to create the given CAD assembly model with two parts: a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom.</description>
